qas.question: When was the first nutrition experiment performed?
What was the name of the overlooked physician that served in the British Navy?
The juice of which fruit was determined to have helped sailors from contracting scurvy?
How many sailors died from scurvy between the years 1500 and 1800?
Which nickname was given to the British sailors?

context: Sometimes overlooked during his life, <a1_0>James Lind<a1_0/>, a physician in the British navy, performed the first scientific nutrition experiment in <a0_0>1747<a0_0/>. Lind discovered that <a2_0>lime<a2_0/> juice saved sailors that had been at sea for years from scurvy, a deadly and painful bleeding disorder. Between 1500 and 1800, an estimated <a3_0>two million<a3_0/> sailors had died of scurvy. The discovery was ignored for forty years, after which British sailors became known as "<a4_0>limeys<a4_0/>." The essential vitamin C within citrus fruits would not be identified by scientists until 1932.
